title: ‘The Up's and the Down's of working at Vodafone’
pros:
I enjoyed working with all the different people. Everyone was highly educated and motivated. The structure of the company was of the highest I have ever worked in. They even had 6 Sigma Black Belts training.
Great perk was the free phone and plan.
cons: Working in a highly fast pace company can be demanding. You really need to manage your time well and learn how to push back on stakeholders. There was also a few political debates with management in regards to moving to the top of the corporate ladder.

title: ‘Best job I’ve ever had!’
pros:
Engaging and collaborative culture.
Area/location I worked in left little room for promotion, however my leaders always found ways to continue to develop myself and my team and keep us engaged
cons: Sometimes different leaders had different ‘approaches’ and weren’t as accomodating as others.. however this was a short lived experience for me, and I still worked there for a significant period of time.

title: ‘Awesome values based company with opportunities to learn and grow and be rewarded for extremely hard and sometimes difficult work.’
pros:
Great training facilities and trainers who are upto date with the best ways to sell a plan, phone or data product. The best training for customer service roles and conflict resolutions. 
Variable 7 day rosters - can choose to start early finish early or start around midday enabling sports training or attend appointments. Weekend work (time & half or double on Sundays) frees up a week day or two for things like shopping.
cons: Targets and KPI's are set almost as a challenge. No commission if not 100% reached each month.  Some restrictions on what can be used in a conflict resolution. Sometimes a competitor would give extra rewards / discounts for switching to their provider and marketing wouldn't allow a match to secure the contract.

title: ‘Retail gopher on a sl4ve wage disguised by empty commission promises’
pros: Don’t have to think about your job. sometimes you get discounts on services. you can do your groceries during your shift if you work in mall retail. it’s a big company so you can complain to an ombudsman if they mess up your pay
cons:
The company is a mess and all you’re doing is calling employee support to get discounts that people are promised over the phone and not given. 

efforts go completely unnoticed and enhanced careers are only afforded to those living in major cities.

title: ‘Never had so much fun while being at work, while earning good money’
pros: Great people, really helpful if your a new employee. Training provided is in depth and ongoing training is provided in store as you develop your skill set. Management that I experienced was fair, kind and understanding. Great place to work for a career or as a place to earn good money while studying. Flat rate plus sales bonuses with reasonable monthly targets. I personally have never worked in a better environment and met some really great people and learned valuable skills and gained great experience. Plus the company always pays for dinner and drinks when they call a statewide meeting!
cons: It is a customer service job. So sometimes you have to deal with difficult situations. Unhappy customers and sometimes there are technical.issues with the computers and this can frustrate both fellow employees and customers. Vodafone sells phones and tablets and mobile internet so another challenge is learning how to use the products your selling.

title: ‘Amazing and inclusive company that encourages you to be the best you can be and supports you along the way.’
pros: Great collaborative, creative and inclusive organisation.  The diverse people are amazing, and it is a great environment to learn and grow.
cons: Constantly evolving organisation where deadlines and objectives can be tight, however this agile environment is amazing for career growth and opportunities.

title: ‘Four seasons in a day’
pros: Generally steady stable work, good people to work with and fun being around new technology all the time
cons: Different people everyday,every job has its routines but the people you interact with everyday are different and want/need different things. Not easy to solve sometimes impossible but it keeps thing's interesting.

title: ‘I loved working with Vodafone, I miss the work culture so much. If it wasn’t for my own personal career development I wouldn’t have left’
pros: Vodafone provides such a great work culture which fosters inclusion, diversity and being your true self at work. Great part time job for a uni student, very flexible in terms of hours and time off
cons: Monthly targets, dealing with high volume of demanding customers

title: ‘Exciting and challenging yet driven by unsaid culure’
pros: Ability to grow and experience cross functional opportunities
cons: Politically driven behaviours

title: ‘Well I have dealt so many customers.And I will just say I JUST LOVE TO BE PART OF VODAFONE .I FEEL LIKE IT IS MY SECOND HOME \"’
pros: Good things about this job because I love it ..If you love to talk with the people and you care people by heart its one of the the best job For you  I bet....
cons:
Oh yea..
Heaps of challenges
One of the challeng u need to understand ur co workers,new culture,work environment.If u r good attitude manners respectful friendly and work habits will show that u r professional,
At some point u will do the mistake,but try to learn from the mistake.
Time management: u have to be very very flexible.
U must hv know the work ethics 
Problem with the boss :Offer a solution that will help the both of u meet ur goals and look good
Prepare of consequences

title: ‘Culture and Atmosphere made me leapfrog out of bed everyday. Bonus was that was very well paid to do my job.’
pros: Environment and the culture were always very important, work life balance and an atmosphere that was buzzing daily.
cons: Always on the Run chasing your next sale because the commission structure was very rewarding. Challenge was the product was on the nose with buyers.

title: ‘Mentally stimulating’
pros: I learned so much working for Vodafone. The nature of the job keeps you mentally stimulated and on your toes. The diversity of the work environment was also great for me and I enjoyed interacting with a wide range of people on a daily basis.
cons: Dealing with a wide demographic of clients is always a challenge. You need to be skilled in conflict management and be a real people person.

title: ‘Good place to build your career foundation’
pros: Great first place to work at, plenty of opportunities to grow and learn. There are lots of areas where you can advance to laterally.
cons: Some team members were difficult to deal with and poorly managed by the supervisors.

title: ‘The best job for uni students.’
pros: Vodafone are highly supportive of personal development and as such hire many uni students. They provide a great work life balance and consequently this job has been perfect throughout my law degree.
cons: The challenges are the requirements to perform. It is a rewarding job but not without hard work and sales ability.

title: ‘Not worth it’
pros: My team within my store was absolutely amazing! My store mamanger and 2IC were absolutely wonderful and caring people whom i miss dearly
cons:
Consistently short staff
Didn’t get meal breaks
Ridiculous targets
Area manager showed no concern for staffs emotional wellbeing

title: ‘A challenging role working alongside a great bunch of people where we were all stretched in multiple directions.’
pros: The people I worked with were great - a really friendly and helpful bunch that were great value. Our wider team had great weekly catch ups so you knew what everyones priorities were for the week and we'd get fed down to us if priorities had changed.
cons: Politics. People trying to climb up the corporate ladder and using you to get there. While I was there the offices were open plan, so you needed to be able to shut yourself out so you could concentrate and get the work done.

title: ‘Lots of pressure, balanced with great working conditons’
pros: Great working conditions, work/life balance is encouraged, performance is rewarded, lots of perks, opportunity to work with a global team
cons: Management too focused on individual KPIs, tendency to react to a competitive market leads to tight deadlines and rushed projects

title: ‘Wonderful while it lasted with the right people’
pros: It was good when Vodafone actually owned it.  Now the darwin stores are franchises and me and my fellow staff lost our jobs. We hardly had any notice it was basically happy New year you are out of a job.
cons: The process of losing a job I loved

title: ‘I was only looking for a part time job while i studied at uni, but now i don’t want to leave after working in such an amazing company.’
pros: One of the best companies i have worked for. Fast progression into other positions and amazing work environment.
cons: Dealing with a variety of customers can be a challenge for some.

title: ‘Best job in ALL aspects’
pros: Work environment is soo friendly. Currently a law student so very stressed but going to work feels like going out and spending time with friends. The staff are amazing and I feel like it is my second home. best job ever in ALL aspects
cons: In work, no challenges but dealing with customers as a sales rep can become almost draining and every job comes with the few very ungrateful customers.

title: ‘Generous Supportive, if a little too process focussed’
pros: Opportunity is everywhere, move sideways, upwards or take advantage of very generous flexibility of work.
cons:
Speed of decisions could be better.  Process can override outcomes.
Trying to implement big company practices in a small more nimble organisation.

title: ‘Overall a great team environment however professionalism of management lacked.’
pros: Great team environment. High levels of sales were rewarded by payment of commission but also rewards such as nights out for the team.
cons: Management lacked professionalism at both store/centre level and area level. I was made to unwillingly move stores three times.

title: ‘Highly recommended.’
pros: Very good working environment, nice people and diverse, you're working with a very large scale systems and you learn lots of things.
cons: Very frequent changes very often, lots of workload, not easy to upgrade to latest technology due to the cost of huge systems upgrade

title: ‘Good but be prepared to work more at this point in time’
pros: Casual wear. Discount pricing, Annual Parties, great work mates
cons: Vodafone is going thru tough times at present after their debacle 4 years ago upgrading their network. So they are doing everything they can to stem the tide to win customers back. Until that time, they will get their employees working more than other companies in the telco space
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘If you're looking for an IT role... Keep looking’
pros: Reasonably good job flexibility
cons: Layers upon layers of management. Lack of strategy. Disconnected management. Aging infrastructure and technologies.

title: ‘A good company, that generally looks after it's staff quite well, but delivers a mixed experience to customers’
pros: Good team, some fun perks. There were some great bonuses for successful performance, which was nicely rewarding. The desire in some levels of management to push for innovation and further growth is great, making some roles in the company very exciting and rewarding.
cons: There were persistent internal issues with systems which made the role quite a challenge. Added to network issues, the ability to offer premium customer service was also a challenge. Very much a larger corporate environment, which is not everyone's taste.

title: ‘Good people who are hard to work with.’
pros: Relaxed environment with a good out of work hours culture.
cons:
Getting a full brief for a project up front - always getting drip fed information and requirements makes it hard to plan ahead. 
Limited accountability from people for their work. 
Many conflicting or competing priorities.

title: ‘Great work, great experiences, great money, unfortunate centre manager’
pros: Great working environment, great incentives. Relaxed atmosphere with the ability to earn good money
cons: The management structure was unfortunately headed by someone that knew nothing about the role, and as such the area that I worked in was made redundant.

title: ‘Regret working there, not a pleasant experience and wouldn't recommend.’
pros: Close to public transport.
cons: Management team didn't care about staff's overall well-being, instead just treated us like money making machines. Often put the blame on junior staff before knowing the whole story. Stores are short of staff so some of us are always working over time. Poor salary and no penalty rates for weekend work. Because of commission there is always unhealthy competition going on in the stores

title: ‘Learnt heaps and made some great friends and contacts’
pros: Quick to market for new products, people good to work with, partners good to work with, new phones
cons: Upper management politics, network perception challenging, systems hard to change

title: ‘Learning and Enjoying working here’
pros: Interaction with different peoples and helping them as per their needs. It also helps me to understand Australian work culture and sharpening my communication skills
cons: Handling multiple queries at one time

title: ‘Repetitive work but good environment’
pros: There was a good team environment and the management always tried to incooperate games and activities into the day when there were holidays on eg. (Easter/Christmas)
cons: The training package was poor and it felt like the company just wanted staff taking calls and spent less time training them initially which cause issues down the track

title: ‘Good pay but it would be a hard career to maintain long term.’
pros: The events that were put on were good but it was rare for general staff to be able to attend due to work schedules. The Games/chill out area was nice but again work rostering meant hardly any enjoyment could be had as your close associates were never on break at the same time.
cons: The general set up of the telecommunications industry and the 'reliability' of service made it difficult.

title: ‘Best three year, walked away with many memories, stories and friendships.’
pros: Great Staff, On the job training, amazing christmas parties
cons: Very busy and not one customer is the same, quick thinking and problem solving is a must. Being able to adapt to each customers needs and wants.

title: ‘I made a lot of good friends over 7 years.’
pros: Great competIve environment and pay model.
cons: When they cut pay by way of commission structure which everyone really felt. They were merciless.

title: ‘Perfect’
pros: Working with great people
cons: Every day it's different

pros: Great perks, development and time being invested in us as graduates SIM card and phone included in package.

pros: Before VHA it was digicall and working for them was a 7star rating but once VHA took over we were slowly managed out as commissions were decreased dramatically
cons: A lot of different types of customers to satisfy from people who didn't know how to operate the handset to businesses with 36phone numbers on the account all set up by yours truly ;)

Capabilities are not developed in house
Workforce skill-set is very limited

pros: Amazing culture

title: ‘The people are what makes this a great place to work.’

location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Terrible upper management’
pros: Good culture store-level teams, fun environment at times, good commission structure & earning potential, opportunity for development
cons: Too many to list here

title: ‘Enlightening and fun wveryday is different and you meet so many different people’
pros: Great atmosphere and working environment
cons: Not going to work when your sick because its so much fun

title: ‘Fun place to work full or great people’
pros: Fun company, good company values
cons: Not much opportunity for growth (region/location dependant)

title: ‘It was an experience’
pros: There are great benefits and staff discounts, working flexibility.
cons: Team communication and direction are challenging in this environment.

title: ‘Great work environment with opportunities to develop oneself’
pros: The working environment is great. Colleagues and managers have a good relationship with each other and work well together. Positive environment is always encouraged and maintained.
cons: Management is something the company needs to work upon. It can be a bit discouraging to work upwards within the company, however with some improvement in management, that can be sorted.

title: ‘Great pay however poor culture.’
pros: Great pay, great people
cons: Poor management from Executives and Senior Management. Too focused on results and not people - unable to get this balance. Poor planning constantly impacting the Contact Centre.

title: ‘Great company held back by naive GMs’
pros: Network now works well. Can do attitude. Lack basic formalism. Intention to get there despite some pushing against it.
cons: Potential customers don't know network works well. GMs have too much power over activities and their management.  GMs keep changing direction each other day, and lose opportunity to do much better. Headcount managed tightly - keep CV warm especially in December, just before Christmas! Jingle bells!
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Been a fun journey. Ranked up from part timer, to full timer, to assistant store manager to business specialist in a matter of year and a bit. It's the people that you work with makes the most of it. Customers are customers wherever you go.’
pros: Mostly it depends where you work, it's the people you work with.
cons: Hitting monthly targets and balanced throughout different categories.. Always a challenge. And working with diverse people; you either click or move on..

title: ‘No two day's are the same with a verity of customers to deal with.’
pros:
Great work culture with flexible work hours.
Achievable monthly targets, remunerated with good commission.
cons: Complicated billing syste. Which in turn becomes challenging to explain to customers.

title: ‘The store had 2 great managers. Thank you to both of them for providing such a great experience. Best Team Ever !’
pros: The Hurstville Store has the best management team ever. Great support from Both Store Managers in the store. Great team environment. Great team building work.
cons: The store was very competitive which made exceeding targets hard.

title: ‘Made lifelong friends but would never go back.’
pros: The people are great, the Hobart office is pretty cool & in a convenient location. Vodafone Group run some great initiatives which carry over to Vodafone Australia, like paid parental leave for dads + equal opportunity projects.
cons: It's a typical big business where there's lots of talk but things never really get done. The same mistakes are made regularly. They're also not at all flexible in terms of working hours. You work when they tell you to work & for how many hours they tell you or find somewhere else. They used to be more reasonable & allow things like job sharing + roster preferences.

title: ‘A great job for high school leavers.’
pros: They pay you well and offer great bonuses. You get given a uniform and they have lots of training.
cons: They do not cater for anyone with other commitments. They do not allow for study or sporting commitments. You are expected to work the full amount of hours.

title: ‘Good as a short-term job with average pay and high work demands, not as a long-term career.’
pros: Flexibility if you're studying or working for more than a single employer.
cons: Very poor career growth opportunity within the company, even from a part-time employee seeking a full-time position with at times unrealistic pressure to achieve.

title: ‘Team  leading and handling at the best’
pros: Customer friendly and close internal and personnel relationship with the staff and management. Good thing is that, being a team leader I learned so much about the company as well as about my skills and ability.
cons: Being a marketing personnel, its important to face challenges everyday. After all that is the ability of marketing staff who bring business for the company. 450 SIM to be sold every month as a target for team leader which my team used to achieve every month.

title: ‘Amazing’
pros: Equal opportunity , good commission structure, great management , they look after the staff with rewards
cons: Maybe a little busy, high demand, high expectation
location: Bondi Junction, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Exciting yet always challenging but definitely unforgettable!!!’
pros: The team environment, learning about new technology, being part of a family.
cons: Its a faced paced working environment so you had to be adaptable to change. It was also challenging learning about new technology, then being able to educate the customers. A lot of products in the industry so that was the biggest challenge.

title: ‘I would recommend people who are after less challenging job and a good life balance to work with vodafone’
pros: The working environment, good work life balance
cons: Structure to promote internally

title: ‘Fantastic experience with great hours, always work to do and customer service oppertunities’
pros: Excellent customer service experience! Enjoying work and once you’ve mastered the system it’s quite enjoyable to work and have a chat while trying to upsell! It’s great to always be in a conversation rather than awkwardly trying to upsell with nothing to talk about!
cons: The system is very hard to use and each stores access with differ making your task harder if you move between stores!

title: ‘Very sad’
pros: Commission before it got taken away.
cons: No love for their staff.

cons: Dealing with a lot of negitive customer but it's great to see that as a challenge and turn them into positive customers

title: ‘Great people, poor leadership and company direction’

title: ‘Good but challenging’

title: ‘Great work life balance and a relaxed but focused culture.’

title: ‘Awful place to work.’

I could go on for ages

title: ‘Great to start and beyond terrible to end’
pros: At first the company had a fantastic level of morale, never felt like just another number.
cons: The change in management, it baca me less about what you could do and the effort you put in but more about how much management liked you.

title: ‘Very frustrating environment.’

cons: Very silo'ed and chaotic; too few processes and procedures in place, conflicting internal objectives, impossible to get things done effectively.

title: ‘I got the chance to deliver the best outcome that was possible at that time, but this achievement was not appreciated too much. ’

Parental and additional annual leaving packages
Generous redundancy

Lack of alignment with the strategy
Political machinations instead of professional leadership
At least 2 reorganization per year based on the passed 7 years experiences

title: ‘First year or so was great after that not so great. Company really need to evaluate their middle management as I know a lot of good staff have left due to management’
pros: Great incentives given by business partners of Vodafone
cons: Middle management makes it hard to preform well. With ridiculous expectations not given by the company itself by store and territory managers. Indecent remarks became quite regular in a lot of stores I worked in by management.

title: ‘No career development or lateral movement path.’
pros:
Great quarterly celebrations thrown by larger business.
Free mobile phone plan.
cons: Higher Management did not adhere to their own leadership training. Not a supportive environment for store managers. Store managers were not offered support by regional managers, and regional managers acted in unprofessional and vindictive manner. HR issues raised not followed through with. No progression for achievement and through development, only through office politics.

title: ‘Great company and even better people ’
